questions.question: Who is Pluto?

choices.answer: Pluto is the narrator's cat
Pluto is the narrator's doctor
Pluto is the narrator's dog
Pluto is the barkeep in the narrator's favorite tavern

questions.question: What was the first violent act the narrator did to Pluto?

choices.answer: He broke Pluto's leg
He threw Pluto in the icy river
He cut Pluto's eye out
He threw Pluto into the fire place and burned him

questions.question: What second act did the narrator commit on Pluto?

choices.answer: He broke Pluto's leg
He buried Pluto alive in the yard
He hung Pluto from a rope and killed him
He throw Pluto into the fire place and burned him

questions.question: What was left of the narrator's home after the fire?

choices.answer: The tree in the garden was the only thing left
One wall with the figure of the cat on it was left
The narrator's bed was the only thing left
The cat's body was left on the remains of the mattress.

questions.question: Describe the second cat

choices.answer: The second cat was all white
The second cat was larger with white paws
The second cat was the same as Pluto but with two eyes
The second cat looked like Pluto except for the white mark

questions.question: What peculiar mark did the second cat have?

choices.answer: The cat has a white circle around one eye
The cat had a white mark on its face
The cat had a white mark on its back
The cat had some white on its neck/breast area

questions.question: Why did the narrator kill his wife?

choices.answer: He thought she was turning into a cat
She wanted to get rid of the cat
She tried to stop him from killing the cat
He thought he heard the cat tell him to do it

questions.question: How did he dispose of the body?

choices.answer: He cut it up and burned it
He bricked it up in the chimney wall
He dug a grave and buried it in the floor of the cellar
He threw it in a river

questions.question: Who came on the fourth day after the murder?

choices.answer: His in-laws
The police
The neighbors
The doctor and nurse

questions.question: What was the narrator's reaction to the arrival on the fourth day

choices.answer: He told them his wife was away on a trip
He pretended he wasn't home
He said he was sick and they couldn't stay long
He invited them in to show them around

questions.question: How did the police discover the body?

choices.answer: The stench of the decaying body was overwhelming
The policeman leaned against the wall and it fell over
The cat screamed from behind the wall
The cat started scratching at the wall

questions.question: Where is the climax of the story?

choices.answer: When the narrator kills his wife
When the cat screams
When the narrator finds the second cat
When the narrator is hung

questions.question: Which of these is most important to Poe's purpose in the Black Cat?

choices.answer: Examining the narrator's mental state
Surprising the reader
Showing cruelty to animals
Describing the murders

questions.question: How does Poe allow the reader to become more immersed in The Black Cat?

choices.answer: He names the cat but not the wife
He keeps the cat's entombment a secret
He describes things in great detail
He uses a vague setting

questions.question: What value does using the first person narrative add to The Black Cat?

choices.answer: It allows us to see the workings of the mind of the narrator
It eliminates unnecessary characters
It makes the action go more quickly
It makes the story easier to follow

questions.question: What was the Red Death?

choices.answer: An algae contamination that turned all of the water red
It was a highly contagious disease
It was a series of brutal, bloody murders
It was a red rope that the prince used to hang his enemies

questions.question: Why did the Prince gather 1,000 of his subject into the castle?

choices.answer: He wanted them to witness the baptism of his son
He know the peasants planned a revolt
He wanted to save the people who hadn't died from Red Death
He needed money

questions.question: How many rooms were in use the night of the masquerade ball?
In which room were the windows a different color than the color of the room?

choices.answer: White room
Purple room
Black room
Red room

questions.question: Why did the orchestra pause each hour?

choices.answer: They paused for the striking of the ebony clock
They paused for refreshments
They paused for the blessing of the hour
They paused to let the Prince play piano

questions.question: Why did the newly masked figure draw attention?

choices.answer: It only had a right arm and left leg
It was dressed as a corpse of someone who died of Red Death
It had real blood flowing from several wounds
It arrived in a coach with several servants

questions.question: What was Prince Prospero's reaction to the figure?

choices.answer: He bellowed that someone unmask the figure
He ordered the guards to kill the figure
He treated it like royalty
He urged the guests to ignore the figure

questions.question: How did the story end?

choices.answer: The Prince killed everyone in his rage at the intruder
The people all panicked
Everyone in the room contracted the disease and died
The Prince died, but the others survived

questions.question: What is the moral of the story in The Masque of the Red Death?

choices.answer: Royalty in itself is not protection
Debauchery in the face of illness will be punished
You can't hide from death
The Prince died, but the others surived

questions.question: Explain the significance of "three thousand and six hundred seconds to the Time that flies."

choices.answer: Some people, like the Prince, are very interested in details
Death is a natural part of life
Life's fleeting moments often slip by
Machines go on even when human life ends

questions.question: In The Raven the speaker thinks the noise he hears is...

choices.answer: his enemy stalking him
the wind blowing the door open
someone at the door
his friends playing tricks on him

questions.question: In The Raven, when the narrator opens the door he half expects to find

choices.answer: A Greek god
The woman he had loved, who has died
A group of angels
the image of his own death

questions.question: Why does the poet have the Raven perch on the bust of the Greek goddess of Pallas?

choices.answer: Ravens were sacred to the Greeks
The speaker associates Pallas with his dead love, Lenore
The association suggests the Raven is wise
The poet is suggesting that this poem takes place in Greece

questions.question: At the first encounter, the speakers reaction to the Raven is...

choices.answer: fear
anger
revulsion
amusement

questions.question: When the Raven says "Nevermore", the speaker takes this response to be...

choices.answer: the bird's name
a message from Lenore
a prophecy
the words of an evil spirit

questions.question: The narrator guesses that the Raven says "Nevermore" because

choices.answer: it had been listening to the narrator mourning for Lenore
Lenore had kept it as a pet
its former master was an unhappy person
the narrator's enemy taught it this word to torture him

questions.question: The speaker can best be described as

choices.answer: lonely, elderly man longing for visitors
poet seeking inspiration for a new work
magician conjuring up evil spirits
melancholy person trying to forget a great tradgedy

questions.question: What is the poem's mood? (The Raven)

choices.answer: Reassuring
Soothing
Romantic
Despairing

questions.question: What is the narrator doing to forget his sorrows over losing Lenore?

choices.answer: Napping
Reading
Drinking
Nothing

questions.question: Which of the following does the narrator ask the Raven?

choices.answer: Will you leave me tomorrow?
Who sent you?
Will I be reunited with Lenore
Are you a bird or devil?
